title: SolarWinds Hack Pits Microsoft Against Dell, IBM on Storing Data
summary: Microsoft argues the cloud offers more protection; rivals point to the need of firms to hold, access their information on-premises. The cyberattack that compromised many U.S. government and corporate networks is fueling a debate among big tech companies over what the safest way is for customers to store critical data.

title: McDonald's Considers Partial Sale of Digital Startup Dynamic Yield
summary: Fast-food chain says review of transactions found the company's technology had contributed to sales less than originally reported. McDonald's Corp. said it is considering selling part of digital startup Dynamic Yield Ltd., which it acquired less than two years ago in a bid to boost sales at drive-throughs and digital kiosks.

title: Biden Urges Fast Action on Covid-19 Stimulus Package
summary: After the House passed the legislation, the president says, 'If we act quickly, decisively and boldly, we can finally get ahead of this virus'. WASHINGTON-President Biden urged the Senate to take quick action after the House passed his $1.9 trillion Covid-19 relief package, as Democrats faced intraparty rifts over the future of a worker-pay increase.

title: New York Theatre Workshop Marks 25th Anniversary of 'Rent'
summary: Off-Broadway company is set to celebrate-with a March 2 streaming event-the hit 1990s musical that put the troupe on the map and filled its coffers. Long before Jonathan Larson's "Rent" became a Broadway sensation, the musical needed a home to help see it through development. So, in 1992, Mr. Larson, then a largely unknown composer and lyricist, reached out to Jim Nicola, artistic director of the New York Theatre Workshop, a nonprofit off-Broadway company that had recently moved into a new home in Manhattan's East Village neighborhood.

title: Inside CPAC: 2020 What-Ifs, Covid Skepticism, Unity Behind Trump

title: Warren Buffett Defends Berkshire Hathaway's $25 Billion in Buybacks
summary: The Omaha conglomerate's fourth-quarter profits rose nearly 23%. Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc. posted an increased fourth-quarter profit Saturday, with the billionaire investor using his annual missive to investors to explain a recent surge in stock buybacks.

title: These Companies Say J-Pop Will Be Even Bigger Than BTS and K-Pop
summary: Resume Subscription. K-pop has become a global sensation, with acts like BTS and Blackpink amassing fans far beyond Asia.

title: Goodbye, Concert Tees? Verzuz, Harry Styles and Streaming Are Changing the Merch Game
summary: After the pandemic killed music tours and their opportunities to sell concert T-shirts and other products, the industry pivoted to streaming. For some artists, that's only expanded the merch market.. IN THE SUMMER of 2018, Grace Hall-Ramsay attended a live Harry Styles concert in San Jose, Calif., and had a life-changing experience. The British pop star spotted the 18-year-old in the audience holding a sign that read "I'm Gonna Come Out to My Parents Because of You!" He asked for her mother's name and-told it was Tina-proceeded to goad a crowd of thousands to yell in unison, "Tina, she's gay." The moment understandably went viral. Ms. Hall-Ramsey, an ardent Styler-as the singer's fans call themselves-had planned to attend 20 Harry Styles concerts in 2020.

title: Some People Buy Vintage Corvettes or Mustangs. He Collects Edsels.
summary: Hank Davis owns 14 cars from Ford's famously doomed 1950s brand maligned for looking like an 'Oldsmobile sucking a lemon'. Hank Davis, 63, owner of Hank's Garage, an auto shop and used car dealership in Bucyrus, Ohio, on his Edsels, as told to A.J. Baime.

title: Cold War-Era Defense System to Get Upgrade to Counter Russia, China
summary: The U.S. and Canada move to modernize a missile-surveillance system in the Arctic that officials say is outdated. TORONTO-The U.S. and Canada plan to modernize a network of defense satellites and radar in the Arctic, in a bid to counter a growing military presence in the north from Russia and China.

title: $15 Minimum-Wage Setback Tests Biden's Ability to Unite Democrats
summary: Progressive lawmakers and activists floated overturning parliamentarian's decision or abolishing 60-vote Senate threshold. A major setback this week to the administration's push for a $15 federal minimum wage could test President Biden's ability to keep Democrats united and shape his relationship with progressives.

title: Declutter the Filing Cabinet: What to Save, Move to the Cloud or Shred
summary: With tax season under way, now is a good time to scan and purge those old files. When was the last time you cleaned up the family filing cabinet? Be honest. If you're like me, that unsightly metal rectangle is probably overstuffed with old utility bills, medical records and tax returns. With tax season under way and extra time at home, it isn't a bad time to do some spring cleaning.

title: Congress Revives Push for Equal Rights Amendment
summary: Resume Subscription. WASHINGTON-Almost 50 years after Congress passed the Equal Rights Amendment, the fight is intensifying over whether lawmakers can lift the decades-past deadline for states to ratify it and add it to the Constitution.

title: Nigerian Schoolboys Freed as Search for Abducted Girls Continues
summary: The 42 people released, including 27 schoolboys, had been taken last week from their boarding school. Gunmen in Nigeria released 42 people on Saturday, including 27 schoolboys, who were kidnapped from their boarding school last week in the north-central state of Niger, the state's governor said.

title: From Dua Lipa to Haim, the Best Songs You Should Be Listening to Right Now
summary: Here's WSJ.'s monthly roundup of new pop releases: everything that's grabbing our attention, making us think or getting us dancing. Pop star Dua Lipa's "We're Good" leans in a more tropical direction than the disco-influenced tracks she released last year on her second album, Future Nostalgia. The track fantasizes about a cordial end to a relationship. "Let's end it like we should and say we're good," Dua Lipa sings over laid-back, mid-tempo instrumentals, perhaps implying that a clean breakup is as dreamy as a seaside vacation.

title: The U.S. Has a National Help Line for Pandemics but Isn't Using It
summary: The CDC built and tested a telephone hotline with a vaccine-booking system, but it hasn't been used in the Covid-19 pandemic. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention for years has had the ability to activate a nationwide telephone hotline and vaccine-appointment system during public-health emergencies.

title: 'Road to the Sun' by Pat Metheny Review: A Bright Fusion of Genres
summary: The jazz guitarist experiments with classical composition on an album with the Los Angeles Guitar Quartet and Jason Vieaux..

summary: The Worcester Art Museum highlights the iconic garment and its influence on three centuries of printmaking..

title: Proper Form and Other Workout Advice for The Wall Street Journal Fitness Challenge
summary: Experts answer readers' questions about the right technique for push-ups and other exercises.. We received tremendous feedback from participants in The Wall Street Journal Fitness Challenge, a six-week program developed by Arnie Kander, an NBA sports performance coach. Haven't signed up yet? You can start at any time here.

title: Covid-19 Picture Brightens in U.S., but Virus Isn't Done Yet
summary: Case counts have fallen from records but remain high, and vaccination effort races against variants. Many infectious-disease experts in the U.S. are cautiously optimistic. Covid-19 cases, hospitalizations and deaths have all sharply dropped in recent weeks as the country comes down from its deadliest surge yet, and vaccination campaigns are getting more shots into people's arms. Warmer weather is around the corner.

summary: Resume Subscription. Roblox Corp. Chief Executive David Baszucki won the loyalty of tens of millions of videogamers with a do-it-yourself approach to play that defies the industry's typical formula for success.

summary: Parliamentarian said current minimum-wage proposal isn't allowed in package under Senate rules. WASHINGTON-The House passed President Biden's $1.9 trillion Covid-19 relief package, sending the legislation to the Senate as Democrats faced intraparty rifts over the future of a worker-pay increase.

title: What's Missing in the Electric-Vehicle Revolution: Enough Places to Plug In
summary: As dozens of new battery-powered, plug-in car models come to market, roadtrippers who bought anything but a Tesla are discovering that America's charging infrastructure isn't ready for prime time. Bradley Wilkinson is the owner of a 2017 Chevrolet Bolt, and the kind of electric-vehicle diehard who knows how to squeeze every last mile of range out of his vehicle.

summary: Sarah Friar relies on family and friends as the foundation for her own social network. title: Supreme Court Sides With California Churches on Covid-19 Restrictions
summary: Order blocks Santa Clara County from including churches in ban on indoor gatherings. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court exempted five California churches from a county health directive intended to stem the coronavirus pandemic by prohibiting indoor gatherings.

title: Senate Democrats Look for Backup Plan to Raise Minimum Wage Through Taxes
summary: Proponents craft a plan of tax penalties and incentives to prompt pay increases after parliamentarian rejects wage hike in relief plan. WASHINGTON-Senate Democrats began preparing a backup plan Friday for raising the minimum wage at some large companies as part of their coronavirus relief package, after the chamber's parliamentarian ruled out including a broader increase.

title: Stocks Cap Losing Week as Bond Yields Jump
summary: Nasdaq bounces back, but still ends week down 4.9%, amid worries about monetary-policy response to growth. Rising bond yields blunted U.S. stocks' market momentum this week despite signs of an improving American economy.

title: Fidelity's Charitable Arm Wins in Hedge-Fund Founders' Lawsuit
summary: Judge says Fidelity didn't break promises or make negligent stock sales after donation tied to tax break. The charitable arm of Fidelity Investments on Friday won a lawsuit brought by a wealthy couple over the handling of stock sales tied to a tax break.

title: Nevada Governor Lays Out Plans for a City Built on Blockchain
summary: Gov. Steve Sisolak proposes letting companies develop 'innovation zones' with their own cities and governments to boost state economy. Nevada Gov. Steve Sisolak on Friday unveiled details behind a plan to allow private industry to develop technology "innovation zones" that would include new cities with their own government.

title: Arrests of Unaccompanied Immigrant Children at Southern Border Surge
summary: Government projects about 9,000 children will be taken into custody by the end of February, complicating Biden administration's task. WASHINGTON-The number of unaccompanied immigrant children arrested for crossing the U.S. southern border illegally is on pace to rise more than 50% in February compared with the previous month, people familiar with the matter said, raising the prospect of a humanitarian crisis there.

title: Biden Visits Texas as Regulators Begin to Examine State's Electric Grid
summary: Washington delivers emergency aid after winter storm knocked out power across Texas, but any federal moves to fix grid face obstacles. Federal officials are rushing emergency relief to Texas for its power crisis, though longer-term efforts to shore up the electric grid are likely to run into political obstacles and challenges to Washington's authority.

title: Energy Secretary Eyes Big Investments in Clean Technologies, Electric Grid
summary: Jennifer Granholm looks to reinvigorate a $40 billion energy loan program left untouched under the Trump administration. WASHINGTON-The new U.S. energy secretary said Friday she plans to revive a $40 billion loan program for energy projects and to push for improvements to the country's electric grid in the aftermath of this month's deadly, widespread blackout.

title: Texas Power Market Is Short $2.1 Billion in Payments After Freeze
summary: Electric retailers failed to make payments for power purchased when prices skyrocketed during the freeze, state grid operator says. The financial consequences of the Texas blackouts are beginning to emerge in the state's electricity market, with some players failing to pay for power they purchased last week and others disclosing sizable losses.

title: Biden Offers Words of Comfort and Aid to Texans After Winter Storms
summary: Calling 2020 one of the most painful years in American history, the president cautioned that the coronavirus pandemic is far from over. HOUSTON-President Biden used a visit to Houston to reassure Texans struggling with the twin crises of recent winter storms and the coronavirus pandemic, saying Friday he would help the state "recover and rebuild."

title: Oaktree Capital Draws Activist Ire Over Evictions
summary: An activist group claims evictions are occurring at Oaktree properties despite a federal moratorium during the coronavirus pandemic. Global investment firm Oaktree Capital Management came under fire during a public pension meeting Friday from an activist group demanding the firm's real estate unit halt evictions from residential properties it owns during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: No Republican Civil War Over Trump at CPAC
summary: As Republicans in Washington debate the former president's role in the party, many GOP rising stars, activists and voters have made up their minds. ORLANDO, Fla.-The high-profile split among Republican officials in Washington over Donald Trump isn't on display here, as thousands of conservatives have flocked to CPAC to hear from the former president and some of his staunchest political disciples.
